dcterms:creator: A. E. Motter
M. Gruiz
G. K´arolyi
T. T´el
dcterms:description: The magnetic pendulum system consists of a ferromagnetic bob suspended above the origin of the (x, y) plane, influenced by magnetic forces, gravity, and frictional damping. The dataset is used to train NGRC on varying numbers of trajectories to reconstruct the basins of attraction.
dcterms:title: Magnetic Pendulum Dataset

dcterms:creator: D. Lowe
D. Broomhead
dcterms:description: The RBF dataset consists of radial basis functions used as nonlinear features in NGRC models. It demonstrates that NGRC can learn dynamics and reconstruct basins of attraction using generic nonlinearities.
dcterms:title: Radial Basis Functions (RBF) Dataset

dcterms:creator: D. J. Gauthier
E. Bollt
A. Griffith
W. A. Barbosa
dcterms:description: Next Generation Reservoir Computing (NGRC) is a framework for learning dynamics from data, which has been shown to perform well in various tasks, particularly in modeling chaotic systems.
dcterms:title: Next Generation Reservoir Computing (NGRC)

dcterms:creator: J. Pathak
Z. Lu
B. R. Hunt
M. Girvan
E. Ott
dcterms:description: Reservoir Computing (RC) is a machine learning framework that uses a reservoir of recurrently connected neurons to learn and predict chaotic dynamics from data.
dcterms:title: Reservoir Computing (RC)

dcterms:creator: W. N. van Wieringen
dcterms:description: Tikhonov Regularization is a method used to stabilize the solution of ill-posed problems, often applied in the context of machine learning to prevent overfitting.
dcterms:title: Tikhonov Regularization

dcterms:creator: A. Wikner
J. Harvey
M. Girvan
B. R. Hunt
A. Pomerance
T. Antonsen
E. Ott
dcterms:description: Noise-based Regularization is a technique that introduces noise into the training process to stabilize machine learning predictions, particularly in dynamic systems.
dcterms:title: Noise-based Regularization
